title: MicroservicesMonolithicArchitecture - Q0001
text: What is a monolithic architecture?

options.text: A single unified application where all components are tightly coupled
A distributed system with independent services

explanation: Monolithic architecture is a single unified application where all components are tightly coupled and deployed together.

title: MicroservicesMonolithicArchitecture - Q0002
text: Which of the following best describes the deployment model of a monolithic application?

options.text: All components are deployed together as one unit
Each service runs on a separate server

explanation: In a monolithic architecture, all components are packaged and deployed together as a single unit.

title: MicroservicesMonolithicArchitecture - Q0003
text: Which of the following is a key characteristic of monolithic architecture?
explanation: Monolithic architectures have tightly coupled components that depend on each other within a single codebase.

title: MicroservicesMonolithicArchitecture - Q0004
text: Which of the following is a disadvantage of monolithic architecture?
explanation: Monolithic applications are difficult to scale because all components are deployed together, limiting flexibility.

title: MicroservicesMonolithicArchitecture - Q0005
text: Which of the following is an advantage of monolithic architecture?

options.text: Simpler to develop and deploy initially

explanation: Monolithic architectures are simpler to develop and deploy initially because everything is in one codebase.

title: MicroservicesMonolithicArchitecture - Q0006
text: What happens when one component fails in a monolithic application?

options.text: It can cause the entire application to fail
The system automatically restarts the component

explanation: In monolithic systems, a failure in one component can bring down the entire application due to tight coupling.

title: MicroservicesMonolithicArchitecture - Q0007
text: Which of the following best describes scaling in monolithic architecture?

options.text: Scaling the entire application as a whole

explanation: Monolithic applications can only be scaled as a whole, not by individual components.

title: MicroservicesMonolithicArchitecture - Q0008
text: Which of the following is a common challenge in monolithic architecture?
explanation: Monolithic applications often have long build and deployment times due to their large, unified codebase.

title: MicroservicesMonolithicArchitecture - Q0009
text: Which of the following is true about monolithic architecture?

options.text: All modules share the same memory and resources
Each module runs in its own process

explanation: In monolithic architecture, all modules share the same memory and resources within a single process.

title: MicroservicesMonolithicArchitecture - Q0010
text: Which of the following is a typical example of a monolithic application?

options.text: A traditional e-commerce web application built as one deployable unit
A distributed system with multiple microservices

explanation: A traditional e-commerce web application built as one deployable unit is an example of a monolithic application.

title: MicroservicesMonolithicArchitecture - Q0011
text: Which of the following is a disadvantage of monolithic architecture for large teams?

options.text: Difficult collaboration due to shared codebase

explanation: Large teams face collaboration challenges in monolithic architectures due to shared codebases and dependencies.

title: MicroservicesMonolithicArchitecture - Q0012
text: Which of the following is a benefit of monolithic architecture for small projects?

options.text: Simpler design and faster initial development

explanation: Monolithic architecture is ideal for small projects due to its simplicity and faster initial development.

title: MicroservicesMonolithicArchitecture - Q0013
text: Which of the following best describes the testing process in monolithic architecture?

options.text: Testing is done on the entire application as a single unit
Testing is automated through service discovery

explanation: In monolithic architecture, testing is performed on the entire application as a single unit.

title: MicroservicesMonolithicArchitecture - Q0014
text: Which of the following is a limitation of monolithic architecture in continuous deployment?

options.text: Requires redeploying the entire application for small changes

explanation: In monolithic architecture, even small changes require redeploying the entire application.

title: MicroservicesMonolithicArchitecture - Q0015
text: Which of the following is a common technology stack for monolithic applications?

options.text: Java EE with a single relational database

explanation: Monolithic applications often use Java EE or similar frameworks with a single relational database.

title: MicroservicesMonolithicArchitecture - Q0016
text: Which of the following is a challenge in scaling monolithic applications?

options.text: Scaling requires replicating the entire application
Scaling can be done per module
Scaling is independent of the database

explanation: Scaling monolithic applications requires replicating the entire application, not individual components.

title: MicroservicesMonolithicArchitecture - Q0017
text: Which of the following is a typical database design in monolithic architecture?

options.text: Single shared database for all modules

explanation: Monolithic architectures typically use a single shared database for all modules.

title: MicroservicesMonolithicArchitecture - Q0018
text: Which of the following is a disadvantage of monolithic architecture for scalability?
explanation: Monolithic architectures cannot scale individual components independently, limiting scalability.

title: MicroservicesMonolithicArchitecture - Q0019
text: Which of the following is a benefit of monolithic architecture for debugging?

options.text: Easier debugging due to single codebase

explanation: Debugging is easier in monolithic architectures because all code resides in a single codebase.

title: MicroservicesMonolithicArchitecture - Q0020
text: Which of the following best describes the coupling in monolithic architecture?
explanation: Monolithic architectures have tightly coupled components that depend on each other within a single codebase.

title: MicroservicesMonolithicArchitecture - Q0021
text: Which of the following is a disadvantage of monolithic architecture for deployment?

options.text: Requires redeploying the entire application for small changes

explanation: In monolithic architecture, even small changes require redeploying the entire application, making deployment slower.

title: MicroservicesMonolithicArchitecture - Q0022
text: Which of the following is a benefit of monolithic architecture for performance?

options.text: Faster inter-module communication due to shared memory
Slower communication due to network calls

explanation: Monolithic applications have faster inter-module communication because all modules share the same memory space.

title: MicroservicesMonolithicArchitecture - Q0023
text: Which of the following is a limitation of monolithic architecture for fault isolation?

options.text: A single failure can affect the entire system
Failures are isolated to individual modules

explanation: In monolithic systems, a single failure can bring down the entire application due to tight coupling.

title: MicroservicesMonolithicArchitecture - Q0024
text: Which of the following is a challenge in maintaining monolithic applications?

options.text: Codebase becomes large and complex over time
Each service is small and independent

explanation: Monolithic applications often become large and complex, making maintenance difficult as the system grows.

title: MicroservicesMonolithicArchitecture - Q0025
text: Which of the following is a benefit of monolithic architecture for small teams?
explanation: Monolithic architecture is easier for small teams to manage due to simpler coordination and development.

title: MicroservicesMonolithicArchitecture - Q0026
text: Which of the following is a disadvantage of monolithic architecture for scalability?
explanation: Monolithic architectures cannot scale individual components independently, limiting scalability.

title: MicroservicesMonolithicArchitecture - Q0027
text: Which of the following is a typical communication pattern in monolithic architecture?
explanation: Monolithic applications use in-process method calls for communication between components.

title: MicroservicesMonolithicArchitecture - Q0028
text: Which of the following is a disadvantage of monolithic architecture for technology diversity?

options.text: Difficult to use multiple technologies in one codebase

explanation: Monolithic architectures make it difficult to use multiple technologies because all components share the same stack.

title: MicroservicesMonolithicArchitecture - Q0029
text: Which of the following is a benefit of monolithic architecture for testing?

options.text: Simpler testing due to single deployment unit

explanation: Testing is simpler in monolithic architecture because the entire application is tested as one unit.

title: MicroservicesMonolithicArchitecture - Q0030
text: Which of the following is a disadvantage of monolithic architecture for continuous delivery?

options.text: Small changes require redeploying the entire application

explanation: In monolithic architecture, even small changes require redeploying the entire application, slowing delivery.

title: MicroservicesMonolithicArchitecture - Q0031
text: Which of the following is a benefit of monolithic architecture for performance optimization?

options.text: Optimizations can be applied globally across the application
Optimizations are limited to individual services

explanation: Performance optimizations can be applied globally in monolithic applications since all components share the same runtime.

title: MicroservicesMonolithicArchitecture - Q0032
text: Which of the following is a disadvantage of monolithic architecture for fault tolerance?

options.text: A single bug can crash the entire system

explanation: In monolithic systems, a single bug can crash the entire system due to shared memory and process space.

title: MicroservicesMonolithicArchitecture - Q0033
text: Which of the following is a benefit of monolithic architecture for initial development?

options.text: Faster setup and simpler development process

explanation: Monolithic architecture allows faster setup and simpler development for initial projects.

title: MicroservicesMonolithicArchitecture - Q0034
text: Which of the following is a disadvantage of monolithic architecture for large-scale systems?

options.text: Becomes difficult to manage and scale

explanation: As systems grow, monolithic architectures become difficult to manage and scale due to tight coupling.

title: MicroservicesMonolithicArchitecture - Q0035
text: Which of the following is a benefit of monolithic architecture for debugging?

options.text: Easier debugging due to single process

explanation: Debugging is easier in monolithic architecture because all components run in a single process.

title: MicroservicesMonolithicArchitecture - Q0036
text: Which of the following is a disadvantage of monolithic architecture for team autonomy?

options.text: Teams cannot work independently on different modules
Teams have full ownership of services
Teams can use different tech stacks

explanation: In monolithic architecture, teams cannot work independently because all modules share the same codebase.

title: MicroservicesMonolithicArchitecture - Q0037
text: Which of the following is a benefit of monolithic architecture for resource utilization?

options.text: Efficient resource usage due to shared runtime

explanation: Monolithic applications use resources efficiently because all components share the same runtime environment.

title: MicroservicesMonolithicArchitecture - Q0038
text: Which of the following is a disadvantage of monolithic architecture for flexibility?

options.text: Difficult to adopt new technologies for specific modules

explanation: Monolithic architectures are less flexible because adopting new technologies affects the entire system.

title: MicroservicesMonolithicArchitecture - Q0039
text: Which of the following is a benefit of monolithic architecture for deployment simplicity?

options.text: Single deployment package for the entire application

explanation: Monolithic applications are deployed as a single package, simplifying deployment.

title: MicroservicesMonolithicArchitecture - Q0040
text: Which of the following is a disadvantage of monolithic architecture for scalability?

options.text: Scaling requires replicating the entire application
Scaling can be done per module
Scaling is independent of the database

explanation: Scaling monolithic applications requires replicating the entire application, not individual components.

title: MicroservicesMonolithicArchitecture - Q0041
text: Which of the following is a benefit of monolithic architecture for transaction management?

options.text: Simpler transaction management due to single database

explanation: Monolithic applications have simpler transaction management because they use a single database.

title: MicroservicesMonolithicArchitecture - Q0042
text: Which of the following is a disadvantage of monolithic architecture for fault isolation?

options.text: A single failure can bring down the entire system
Failures are isolated to individual modules

explanation: In monolithic systems, a single failure can bring down the entire system due to shared process space.

title: MicroservicesMonolithicArchitecture - Q0043
text: Which of the following is a benefit of monolithic architecture for debugging?

options.text: Easier debugging due to single process and logs

explanation: Debugging is easier in monolithic architecture because all logs and processes are centralized.

title: MicroservicesMonolithicArchitecture - Q0044
text: Which of the following is a disadvantage of monolithic architecture for agility?

options.text: Slower release cycles due to large codebase

explanation: Monolithic architectures have slower release cycles because changes require redeploying the entire application.

title: MicroservicesMonolithicArchitecture - Q0045
text: Which of the following is a benefit of monolithic architecture for simplicity?
explanation: Monolithic architecture offers simplicity in design and deployment, making it ideal for small projects.

title: MicroservicesMonolithicArchitecture - Q0046
text: Which of the following is a disadvantage of monolithic architecture for modernization?

options.text: Difficult to refactor or migrate to new technologies

explanation: Monolithic architectures are difficult to modernize because all components are tightly coupled.

title: MicroservicesMonolithicArchitecture - Q0047
text: Which of the following is a benefit of monolithic architecture for deployment management?
explanation: Monolithic applications have a single deployment artifact, simplifying deployment management.

title: MicroservicesMonolithicArchitecture - Q0048
text: Which of the following is a disadvantage of monolithic architecture for scalability?

options.text: Scaling requires replicating the entire application
Scaling can be done per module
Scaling is independent of the database

explanation: Scaling monolithic applications requires replicating the entire application, not individual components.

title: MicroservicesMonolithicArchitecture - Q0049
text: Which of the following is a benefit of monolithic architecture for consistency?

options.text: Strong consistency due to single database

explanation: Monolithic applications maintain strong consistency because they use a single database for all operations.

title: MicroservicesMonolithicArchitecture - Q0050
text: Which of the following best describes monolithic architecture in contrast to microservices?

options.text: A single deployable unit with tightly coupled components
A distributed system with independent services

explanation: Monolithic architecture is a single deployable unit where all components are tightly coupled and interdependent.
